starTrek.galaxy

Class Galaxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • starTrek.galaxy.Galaxy

  • public class Galaxy
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all interactions between planets inside of a galaxy.

    It has methods for updating position of planets based on its speed and getting the weather on them according to their relative positions.

    Author:
    Mauro Moltrasio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Galaxy()
      Create a new, empty galaxy.
      Galaxy(java.util.ArrayList<Planet> planets)
      Create a new galaxy with the planets specified.

      • planetsAligned

        public java.lang.Boolean planetsAligned()
        Determine whether the existing planets in this galaxy are aligned among themselves.
        Returns:
        true if planets are aligned

      • planetsAlignedWithSun

        public java.lang.Boolean planetsAlignedWithSun()
        Determine whether the planets in this galaxy are aligned among themselves and with the sun.
        Returns:
        true if all planets and the sun are aligned

      • getWeather

        public java.lang.String getWeather()
                            throws NotEnoughPlanetsException
        Determine the weather of planets based on their current position.
        Returns:
        a String description of the weather
        Throws:
        NotEnoughPlanetsException - exception thrown when there are not enough planets in the galaxy

      • getPerimeter

        public java.lang.Double getPerimeter()
        Determine the perimeter of the polygon created by the planets in this galaxy. If the galaxy has 2 or less planets, the perimeter defaults to 0.
        Returns:
        a Double with the total perimeter
